faculties_accepted: Faculty of Social Sciences (excluding School of Law and Warwick Business School)
module_restrictions: Postgraduate modules are not open to undergraduate exchange students.
The Warwick Business School and Warwick School of Law modules are not available for NUS students with no matching major.
Exchange students are expected to select most of their modules from their base department.
visa_info: All students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they received the official offer letter/email from their host university.
Students on exchange in the UK for less than six months are not entitled to subsidised NHS treatment.
Semester-based exchange students are encouraged to purchase additional insurance to cover medical costs, hospitalisation expenses, and emergency evacuation costs incurred while they are on exchange.
For more information on insurance coverage, please refer to https://myportal.nus.edu.sg/studentportal/student-insurance/all/.
accommodations_info: Warwick offers accommodation subject to availability of rooms and meeting the deadlines and conditions as outlined on the apply webpage.
It is more usual for exchange students to live on-campus, however, for students wishing to live off-campus there are options available.
university_description: The University of Warwick is a public research university located in Coventry, UK. It was founded in 1965 and is consistently ranked among the top ten universities in the UK. It offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate courses across its four faculties and is known for its strong research culture.
